questions.question: Jane cooked dinner …………………………. I watched TV.
questions.description: We use while to talk about two longer actions that go/went on at the same time.

questions.question: Don’t forget to signal ……………………………. turning right.
questions.description: It is possible to leave out subject + be after when.

questions.question: We have been waiting to hear from you ……………………………..
I am going to the movies. Would you like to …………………………… with me?
questions.description: We use come to talk about joining a movement of the speaker’s.

questions.question: Your eyes are just …………………………. mine.
questions.description: We use the same as to say that people or things are identical.

questions.question: The car is running ……………………………… since it had a service.
questions.description: More smoothly is the comparative form of smoothly. Smooth is an adjective.

questions.question: I earn as much money as ………………………… does.
questions.description: We use a subject pronoun before a verb.

questions.question: You are taller than …………………………
questions.description: We prefer object pronouns after than.

questions.question: You are ……………………………. your mother than your father.
questions.description: Like always forms its comparative and superlative forms with more and most.

questions.question: I have given up hope ………………………… them ever again.
questions.description: When hope is a noun, it is followed by preposition + ing form.

questions.question: I hope ………………………….. you soon.
questions.description: When hope is a verb, it is followed by to-infinitive.

questions.question: People disliked him …………………………… he was arrogant.
